popup:
BIG WASTE ENERGY ♻️

Deep beneath the surface of CopenHill is a technological powerhouse that sets a new standard in sustainable energy production and recycling. Denmark’s biggest power plant – known locally as ‘Amager Bakke’ converts 400,000 tonnes of waste per year and provides energy for 62,500 Danish homes by effectively utilizing and burning low-carbon waste. Usually the plant recycles all its water, ash and metal though right now, the power plant is currently not running on it’s full 560.000 Tonnes capacity. In the meantime, ‘Amager Bakke’ is able to help out some of European neighbours with their waste. Aligning with Copenhagen's goal of becoming the world's first carbon-neutral city by 2025.
